sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"尊敬，尊重，敬意"之意。
means: respect ： 指对年长、地位较高的人的尊敬，对他人成就、行为或见解等经过仔细评估后而表示尊重，暗示在上述人面前表现谦恭和有礼貌。
honour ： 指对长辈或有地位、有名望、有功劳的人公开表示极大敬意或软佩。
regard ： 最正式用词，中性，与respect和honour近义。
esteem ： 除表示尊敬之外，还暗示由此可而产生的称赞。
admiration ： 指除表示尊敬外，还常伴随有一种真挚的倾慕之情。

sentence.Network_en: She is full of admiration for the head and teachers.
sentence.Network_cn: 她对校长和教师们满心钦佩。

sentence.Network_en: The paintings she produced in those months won undivided admiration.
sentence.Network_cn: 她那几个月里创作的画作备受推崇。

sentence.Network_en: He won admiration for his forensic skills in cross-examining ministers.
sentence.Network_cn: 他在盘问几位部长时表现出的问案技巧为他赢得了赞赏。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in the sense 'marvelling, wonder'): from Latin admiratio(n-), from the verb admirari (see admire)

entry.def: Admiration is a feeling of great liking and respect for a person or thing.

example.ex: I have always had the greatest admiration for him...

example.tran: 梅格羡慕地睁大了双眼。

means.word_mean: 1. a feeling of delighted approval and liking
2. the feeling aroused by something strange and surprising

sentences.sentence: "a small token in admiration of your works"

auth_sentence.content: Is that really a league worthy of our admiration?
auth_sentence.res_content: Is that really a league worthy of our admiration?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Is that really a league worthy of our admiration?

auth_sentence.content: Instead, I was greeted with smiles of admiration.
auth_sentence.res_content: Instead, I was greeted with smiles of admiration.

auth_sentence.content: It was full of affection and mischief and admiration.

Sentence.sentence: And in fact our admiration for the comically gifted is relatively new and not very well-founded, says Rod Martin's a psychologist at the University of Western Ontario.

sentences.en: His courage and skill compel our admiration.
sentences.cn: 他的勇气和技巧使我们都很钦佩。

sentences.en: My respect for your intelligence is only equalled by my admiration for your integrity.
sentences.cn: 我对你聪明才智的敬佩不亚于对你为人正直的景仰。

sentences.en: They were awed by him and looked at each other in uneasy admiration.
sentences.cn: 他们对他感到敬畏,彼此面面相觑,露出不安的钦佩之情。
这只能使我们更加敬佩。

sentences.en: Your cleverness and skill has compelled our admiration.
sentences.cn: 你的聪明和技巧使我们不得不敬佩。

sentences.en: Lei Feng was the admiration of we all.
sentences.cn: 雷锋是值得我们大家赞美的人。

sentences.en: We paused in admiration of the beautiful view.
sentences.cn: 我们停步欣赏美丽的风景。

sentences.en: He was lost in admiration of the beauty of the scene.
sentences.cn: 他对风景之美赞不绝口。

sentences.en: He tied his tie to admiration.
sentences.cn: 他的领带打得漂亮极了。
